visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a spline chart. The chart should display data for different regions, income levels, and the world, sourced from the World Bank. The chart should have a title derived from the indicator name, a subtitle indicating the data source, and styled axes and labels. The data series should include country, region, income, and world data, with custom colors for each series.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a spline chart. The chart type is set to 'spline', and custom colors are defined for each series. The title of the chart is dynamically set to the indicator name, and a subtitle indicates the data source as the World Bank. The x-axis categories are derived from the reversed YearList array, ensuring the earliest year appears on the left. The y-axis is labeled 'Value' with specified styles for both x and y-axis labels. The plotOptions disable markers for the series points. The tooltip displays the series name and value with two decimal places. The series data includes country, region, income, and world data, all reversed to match the x-axis categories.
